page.title: 05Bank Church Post Office Inn
page.content: The National Westminster Bank on the corner of Longton Road and Barlaston Old Road used to belong to the Sutherland Estate.It was then sold to the Staffordshire Constabulary and used as a Police Station until 1970,when it became a district bank. The Church was purpose built in 1883 by the Methodist denomination.The stone was laid on the 17th May 1883 by Samuel Rathbone and the church has remained Methodist until the present day,with the minister Rev.B.Dodd. The post office started as a maids clothing shop.Then it was a butchers,next a grocers and changed in 1633 to a grocer and post office. The Toby Inn was built in 1880 as the Duke of Sutherland's Hunting Lodge.There are a number of stags heads to be seen inside and outside the building for this reason.
